alert.note: Alert for Baker; Dougherty; Mitchell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 3:58PM EDT until April 05 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Dougherty County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Baker County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 357 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Newton, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Putney around 410 PM EDT. Albany and Marine Corps Logistics Base around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Acree, Lester, Flint, Freeman, Radium Springs, Red Store Crossroads, Williamsburg and Pecan City. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
